intro: [WRONG START] Hordeem muticum var. compressum, commonly known as sea barleygrass, is a perennial grass species native to coastal regions. It thrives in saline and sandy soils, often found along shorelines and in estuarine environments. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It is adapted to withstand harsh coastal conditions, including salt spray and strong winds. Its ecological importance lies in stabilizing dune systems and providing habitat for coastal wildlife.
